etymologies: Middle English: from Old French tabart, of unknown origin

definitions: a sleeveless jerkin consisting only of front and back pieces with a hole for the head

examples.text: the caretaker with her pale blue nylon tabard on
riders wear the same numbered tabard for each event

shortDefinitions: sleeveless jerkin consisting only of front

definitions: a coarse sleeveless garment worn as the outer dress of medieval peasants and clerics, or worn as a surcoat over armor

examples.text: white tabards with crosses on the front

shortDefinitions: sleeveless garment worn by medieval peasants and clerics

definitions: a herald's official coat emblazoned with the arms of the sovereign.
shortDefinitions: herald's official coat emblazoned with arms of sovereign
